Generic Mets/Alto importer¶

A back-bone for any Mets/Alto importer.

Abstract classes¶

class text_importer.importers.mets_alto.classes.MetsAltoNewspaperIssue(issue_dir: impresso_commons.path.path_fs.IssueDirectory)¶

Generic class representing a newspaper issue in Mets/Alto format.

Note

New Mets/Alto importers should sub-class this class and implement its abstract methods (i.e. _find_pages(), _parse_mets()).

Parameters:issue_dir (IssueDir) – Description of parameter issue_dir.
xml¶

Returns a BeautifulSoup object with Mets XML file of the issue.

Note

By default the issue Mets file is the only file containing mets.xml in its file name and located in the directory self.path. Individual importers can overwrite this behavior if necessary.

class text_importer.importers.mets_alto.classes.MetsAltoNewspaperPage(_id: str, n: int, filename: str, basedir: str, encoding: str = 'utf-8')¶

Generic class representing a newspaper page in Alto format.

Note

New Mets/Alto importers should sub-classes this class and implement its abstract methods (i.e. add_issue()).

Parameters:
  • _id (str) – Canonical page ID.
  • n (int) – Page number.
  • filename (str) – Name of the page Alto XML file.
  • basedir (str) – Base directory where Alto files are located.
add_issue(issue)¶

Add to a page object its parent, i.e. the newspaper issue.

This allows each page to preserve contextual information coming from the newspaper issue.

Parameters:issue (NewspaperIssue) – Newspaper issue contaning this page.
parse()¶

Process the page file and transform into canonical format.

Note

This lazy behavior means that the page contents are not processed upon creation of the page object, but only once the parse() method is called.

xml¶

Returns a BeautifulSoup object with Alto XML of the page.

Mets parsing¶

text_importer.importers.mets_alto.mets.parse_mets_amdsec(mets_doc, x_res: str, y_res: str, x_res_default=300, y_res_default=300) → Dict[KT, VT]¶
Parameters:
  • mets_doc – BeautifulSoup document of METS.xml
  • x_res – Field representing the X resolution
  • y_res – Field representing the Y resolution
  • x_res_default – Default X_res (300)
  • y_res_default – Default Y res (300)
Returns:

dict, containing the resolution for each image

Alto parsing¶

Utility functions to parse Alto XML files.

text_importer.importers.mets_alto.alto.distill_coordinates(element: bs4.element.Tag) → List[int]¶

Extract image coordinates from any XML tag.

Note

This function assumes the following attributes to be present in the input XML element: HPOS, VPOS. WIDTH, HEIGHT.

Parameters:element (Tag) – Input XML tag.
Returns:An ordered list of coordinates (x, y, width, height).
Return type:List[int]
text_importer.importers.mets_alto.alto.parse_printspace(element: bs4.element.Tag, mappings: Dict[str, str]) → Tuple[List[dict], List[str]]¶

Parse the <PrintSpace> element of an ALTO XML document.

Parameters:
  • element (Tag) – Input XML element (<PrintSpace>).
  • mappings (Dict[str,str]) – Description of parameter mappings.
Returns:

Description of returned object.
Return type:

List[dict]
text_importer.importers.mets_alto.alto.parse_style(style_div)¶

Parses the font-style information in the ALTO files (BNL and BNF)

Parameters:style_div –
Returns:
